intro: Jamesonia ewanii, commonly known as the Ewan's Jamesonia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its foliage remains green throughout the year, making it a valuable addition to woodland gardens. It is also noted for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions.
